values: Until next time...

I got my VIP ticket for the 2PM/Wonder Girls concert this morning!  Sooo excited!!!

Until next time...

This is me in my Cataloging and Classification class, learning Dewey.  All I want to do is get home, make some food, and enjoy FFA.

Until next time...

I don't want to do homework anymore.  Boo hiss.  Boo hiss.  ;_;

Unitl next time...

What an awesome moment in life.  Jay posted a video of himself singing on YouTube.  Sweeeeeeeeet.  Fighting!

Until next time...

So, it has been 1 1/2 years since my last post.  Sorry about that, LJ.  Working on my masters, living in DC, waiting for the next awesome Kpop post...the usual.  

Until next time...

Now I really feel 30 around the corner.  Where does the time go?

Until next time...

Thank the Lord, I am done with school for as long as I choose!!!  Graduation '07 happened yesterday...woo hoo.  Now I get to become an adult in the real world...boo.  :)

Until next time...

So, my recital was last night.  Well, the first 10 minutes.  For those of you who weren't in Columbus last night, here's the story.  I'm backstage after playing the Mozart with Catherine, tuning my bass from orchestral to solo.  All of a sudden, there is a loud anouncement saying that everyone must go to the basement of the River Center because of tornados that have touched down in Alabama.  So, there are all these people waiting around until 8:30.  Once they let us go, most people left, so those of us still in the school ate the food at my reception.  How awesome is that?  Recital '07!!!  I felt bad because my parents and Reanna drove down from Clay Co to see it.  PLUS, Dr. Rumbelow was there, so he was stuck down there with everyone when I'm sure his wife was wondering if he was OK.  This will make for great stories in the next week.

Until next time...

Who got their GPA back to a 3.0?  Oh yeah, that would be me!  After the sad, SAD dive it took freshman year (damn you alcohol), I have pulled it back to a place that will hopefully help me be considered for grad school.  ::does happy dance::  

Until next time...

Yeah yeah, it's been a while.  I know.  What do you expect?  The semester is over, and all is well.  No more jazz band for me!  Woot!  I actually got around to taping my piano proficiency, and now that is out of the way.  One more semester to go and I'll be done at CSU.  Full recital, here I come!  I'm hoping I can get the date I want.  April 11 (it's a Wed.).  Now, I know what most of you Columbus people must be thinking..."Oh no!  Kelly's graduating!  What are we going to do for a bass studio?"  Fear not friends.  I'll be in Columbus for the following year working like a whore and getting applications out for grad school.  I'm hoping the school will pay me to play for them 'cause that would give me some nice pocket money to pay for that car I plan on getting in a few months.  Yes, it's actually going to happen.  Can you believe it?  I can't.
Congrats to all who graduated this past week!  You all deserve it, and I know you all will do well in life.
So, I'm home until January 6th or 7th.  My poor little bass is going to the shop this week, but I hope to have it back by Saturday at the latest.  I've been at the house with my dad, playing Final Fantasy X.  I'm sooooooooo kicking its ass right now.  I think I'm going to get FF XII and the new version of FF VII when I'm done (I'm hoping the remake FF VIII because that one was my favorite).  I've also considered getting those guitar games for PS2.  Me, Catherine, and Jason have played it at Game Stop...it's really not that bad.  Even a little fun.  Judge if you must, but once you try it, you'll change your mind.  
If anyone wants something fun to do and is in the Clay. Co./ATL area, let me know.  Something may happen.  Bwah-ah-ah!
Guess I'll get back to getting Lulu some more spells.  It will make life alot easier. 

Until next time...

I'm another year older today.  Sad times.

Until next time...

I know, it's been forever...my badd (yeah, 2 d's like Color Me Badd).  I just thought I'd let those out there know I'm alive and taking advantage of what may be my last summer in Columbus (drinking, swimming, chillin', karaoke, and oh so much more...doesn't sound much different from the school year, but whatever, it's what I do).  Little Williams is in town this week observing the children...I don't think he's touched one yet, I'm proud to say.  J/k Jason...maybe.  Looooooooooooooooove yooooooooooooooooou!  
Now to what made me want to post today.  I though I'd do a countdown of those things that are near and dear to my heart.
1) Transformers movie: 355 days (July 4, 2007)...I found out last week that this was happening, AND you can see previews on IMDB!!!  Hey Reanna, do you think that after all these years mashed potatoes can still be your friends?  DARE TO BE STUPID!!!
2) Harry Potter and the *insert book title that a few people know, and I'm not one of them*: 358 days (July 7, 2007...yes, 7/7/07)...This is the date that is set for now, but we know how these things change.  Lets hope it doesn't.
3) Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix: ONE YEAR FROM TODAY! Yeah, I went there...JEALOUS?! I can only imagine how dark this movie will be.  It's going to be HAWT! (And if you haven't heard, M. Night Shyamalan is rumored to be talking to people so he can direct the 6th and MAYBE 7th movies.  Yeah, I know!  They asked him to do the first, but he was doing 'Unbreakable' ~I don't know how to do italics, and I'm too lazy to figure it out~ at the time and now wishes he would have done it.  Aw, sad times).
Others will be added to this list, so stay tuned.

Until next time...

If I were a Dead Russian Composer, I would be Sergei Rakhmaninov.

I lived in the early Twentieth Century and was well known for my compositional, conducting, and piano skills, yet I am melancholy despite this talent. My famous works include my nearly-impossible piano concerti.

Who would you be? Dead Russian Composer Personality Test

Until next time...

1. I'll respond with something random about you
2. I'll challenge you to try something
3. I'll pick a color that I associate with you
4. I'll tell you something I like about you
5. I'll tell you my first/clearest memory of you
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of
7. I'll ask you something I've always wanted to ask you
8. If I do this for you, you must post this on yours

Until next time...

01. Leave me a comment saying, "Interview me."
02. Post this explanation and an offer to interview folks in your lj.
03. I will respond to your comment by asking you five questions of a somewhat questionable or random nature.
04. You will post the results in your lj.
05. When others comment asking to be interviewed, you will ask them five questions and the whole cycle begins again.

Until next time...

6 o'clock can't come soon enough!  This has been THE week from hell.  Here's how it went:

Sunday: 
Wind Ensemble Rehearsal 2-5

Monday:
Classes
Practicing

Tuesday:
Classes
Wind Ensemble Concert

Wednesday (The worst day):
Classes
Lesson (2 hrs)
Recording 6:30-9:30
Mu Phi at 10

Thursday:
Classes
Dr. appointment (yay for congestion and ear infections)
Recording 6:30-9:30

Friday:
Recording 9:30-12:30, 3-6

Sunday:
New Music Ensemble 8-10

So yeah, that's my week.  Sucks to me, I know.  My apartment is a mess, I haven't had time to really practice, and I've forgotten what personal time was like.  My shoulders and back are killing.  What I wouldn't give for a spa day.  At least I'll be drinking heavily tonight at tomorrow.  Yes, yes I will.  Until next time...

Oh sleep, where have you gone?  I miss you.  Please come back, and I promise to pay you more attention!  This is going to be the longest week ever...GMEA, here we come!

Until next time...

Ground Rules: The first player of this "game" starts with the topic "5 Guilty Pleasures" and people who get tagged need to write an LJ entry about their 5 Guilty Pleasures as well as state this rule. In the end, you need to choose the next 5 people to be tagged and list their names.

1. Hello Kitty
2. Drinking a gallon of milk in a day
3. The Dekalb Farmers Market
4. Watching anime all day and quoting the words and singing the songs in Japanese
5. Listening to country when no one else is around

And.... I tag:

Catherine, Jason, Reanna, Jennifer, Stephanie (I was going to put more, but I'll leave some people for others)

Until next time...

So, I'm drunk.  It's been a while since I've made a post.  Went out tonight.  It was fun.  I spent $48 at 2 bars.  Damn you high price vodka.  
Do you ever feel like you're not enough?  You try sooooooooo hard, and you get bits and pieces in return?  I do, and it sucks.  I hate it.  I try, I really do.  all I can do is try harder, and keep crying when I fail.  So is life.

Until next time...

I'm an old bitch.
Until next time...

Boo for hangovers!
Until next time...

This new year seems like it's going to be a bitch.  I'm not liking it at all.  I hate when things are up in the air and I don't know how it all will end.  It leaves me feeling uneasy and I get edgy and upset and I know I start to piss people off after a while.  Just try and go with the flow, and I start to get in that funk, just tell me.  I'm in the need to go on a walk at the river.
In other news...oh wait, there isn't other news.  That's how it goes.  Until next time...

I JUST realized that.  Damn it.  Oh well, there's always next week.
Heidi is coming into town tomorrow with one of her sisters.  She'll be staying at my place.  Ooooooooh Heidi is so funny when she's drunk.  I guess I should finish cleaning my apartment. Hmmm, thought.
I got my recital packet this morning before Instrument Repair.  I'm ACTUALLY doing this. 
Instrument Repair is fun.  I like having access to that room and being able to work on my stuff outside of class.  Woot.
I am hungry now.  I think I'll finish my on-line time here in the fabulous Schwob School of Music Library, then go get some Blimpie's and eat it while I read for Instrumentation and Transcription.  Anyone want to join me?  Until next time...

Today, me and Chris and Jason and Jason's friend went to Tanger Outlet.  I wanted to show Chris the Gap store.  It was a fun day.  The shopping day was a good way to get out of the house, and I got to see Chris and Jason, which was something I hadn't done all break.
I might be going out with Heidi and Jennifer tomorrow.  We were going to wait until I got back from Chicago to swap gifts.  
So, I got an e-mail from Wensell today saying that there is a 2 hour technique master class on Saturday from 2-4.  That doesn't fit into my schedule.  Then there was other stuff in the e-mail about how we all need to sleep more, eat better, exercise, and up the practice time by 25%.  I'm fat, I know it.  I don't like being reminded by my teachers.
Well, I've got DVDs to watch.  Until next time...

The parents went to Kroger, so I'm chillin' by myself.  I went shopping with Heidi last night for some gifts and stuff.  I got a Rainbow Bright DVD.  Heidi found 'Shall We Dance' on VHS, lucky bitch.  It was the original Japanese one.  I love that damn movie.  I swear, Jennifer Lopez really knows how to fuck up a good thing.
We also saw 'Closer'.  Jude Law can have his way with me.  Damn, he's hot!  I think I need to see it again to fully grasp the movie.  Either that or I need to rent it when it comes out on DVD to see the deleted scenes.  I have a feeling there's alot we missed.  I also want to see the play 'cause it seems to end better.
Post anything that you want, and post it anonymously. Anything. A story, a secret, a confession, a fear, a love - anything. Be sure to post anonymously and honestly. Post twice if you'd like. Then, put this in your LJ to see what your friends (and perhaps others who you don't even realize read your LJ) have to say.  Until next time...
I PASSES MUSIC HISTORY!!!  Yay for me!!!  Until next time...

Your Christmas is Most Like: A Christmas Story
Loving, fun, and totally crazy. Don't shoot your eye out!
What Movie Is Your Christmas Most Like?
THIS is Christmas. 24 hours of "A Christmas Story". We always watch it while we open presents, and any other odd time throughout the day. It's one of the few things that Ted Turner is doing right. Until next time...

So, yeah.  Here I am once again.  Today's post comes from the library at the Schwob School of Music and is brought to you by the letters T, G, N, and by the number 3.  I'm waiting for convo, as usual.  Yay for no Friday master class.  Brian is in town until tomorrow, and he's at the bassoon master class right now.  I think he's going to reed class to, so I'll have to find something to do after convo, too.  
Richard and I both passed convo!!!  Woot!!!  You know, we didn't think we'd make it, but in the end we worked hard and pulled it off.  Hopefully next semester won't be so killer...seeing how it's our last one and all.
My jury is Monday at 11:40 am.  So, I get to go to Geology, get a snack, do my jury, and then go to Music History.  Yippie skippie.
Happy Chaunukah to all.  Until next time...

Yeah yeah, I know.  It's been for fucking ever since my last post.  Alot of shit has happened in the past whenever.  I had a paper for Music History (8 pages on the Mozart Bassoon Concerto), I went to the Atlanta Opera to see "Don Giovani", I had a LaGrange gig (yay for paying gigs), there were some issues between me and Brian (but everything is kewl now), and class in general just gets in the way.  There is an Orchestra concert tonight (2 string quartet pieces and then Brahms Symphony 1).  Friday starts the annual Conductor's Workshop weekend here at CSU (luckily I don't have to do any of the workshops this year).  I'm also working on the music for my recital next semester.  That's all that I have on my plate..."'That's all' she says" (Dolly Parton in Steel Magnolias).  
So, last night we had a rehearsal in Legacy for the Orchestra concert.  During Adam and Amanda's joint recital, they were pushing the piano back stage and got it stuck in the door way.  Can you fucking believe that.  One of the people pushing the damn thing is a piano teacher.  I swear.  They were pushing it backwards and when it wouldn't fit through, they decided they would just try to shove it.  Dumbasses.  
I am so GD tired, and no matter how much I sleep, I never feel like it's enough.  This semester is just dragging.  I wish it would end.  Maybe it's that damn 9 am Geology class that I have.  Who knows.  
I fucking hate bras.  This one I'm wearing is so damn uncomfortable.  
Georgia got their asses spanked by Auburn on Saturday...hehehe.
I guess that's all I have to report.  I'm going to check out a pair of headphones so I can listen to some Homestar Runner.  Until next time...

Does it really matter anyways?  Can't we just put it all behind us?  Worse things have happened.  Worse things will happen.  This is not something to get so huffy about.  Especially for those who don't have anything to do with it and are getting in way over their head with this crap.  I'd rather read LJ entries about partying or random road trips or something that doesn't involve name calling or hateful-awful things like that.  Wouldn't everyone else?  I'm sure you would, so let's do that...
This is my last week of not playing in Wind Ensemble.  Their concert is Thursday evening (as usual).  Also, because I'm not in this rotation, I don't have to go to the recording session on Friday.  I always get so nervous in those things.  Whether it be my stool moving or hitting my instrument with my bow...it sucks.  Rumbelow laughs and moves on.  It's cute.  Isn't is Stephanie???  ::thinks on Chang dance::
My dad is home now.  He's having to see a cardiologist sometime soon, and they also found that he is diabetic.  When I go home for Thanksgiving break, I have to go get tested for it and I guess whatever else they can find that's wrong with me.
I'm thinking of minoring in math.  I'm going to look into it at some point toward the end of the semester.  We'll see how that is.
So, that's all I'm posing for now.  Can we please move past all of this and drink this weekend or go do something fun like bowling or skating or baking...ANYTHING!?!?!?  PLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEASE?!?!?!  Until next time...

I saw that little saying on a website last night.  It made me laugh because it is so true.  
I know I know, it's been forever since I've updated.  My badd...2 d's.  I'm home for fall break now.  I got back to Clay. Co. yesterday (Chris brought me by).  It's weird being home.  I miss doing whatever the fuck I want whenever I want, and having the option of doing it naked.  All I've really done is watch TV and listen to Brahms 1 while I read my part.  We're supposed to know the 4th movement by Wednesday.  I'm going to try and go back to C-town on Monday so I can actually play through the part on my bass.  I miss him so.  
Wow, they've changed Live Journal since the last time I made an entry.  Interesting.
My mom took my dad to the hospital a little while ago because he thinks that he might have had a mild stroke.  I'm like...ok.  I don't know how I'm really supposed to take it, ya know?  
Ok, I could have sworn that I just felt my house shake.  I don't know if it was the surround sound from the TV or if it was something outside.  If I wasn't so lazy I'd go out there to see if anything happened.  
So, I guess that's all for now.  There's some ice cream in the freezer that's calling my name.  Until next time...

I miss you terribly!!!

Until next time...

So, I went to Madison yesterday and took Chris' tour.  It was really nice.  Beautiful day, and we learned some stuff.  Chris learned some stuff.  Some things were too deep.  Too too deep.  My family...wow.
I played cards tonight with Jack, Cindy, and my parents.  I think I may look into getting that game for future fun nights in Columbus.  It will be something to have once we get tired of 'Candy Land'.
I keep yawning.
I am in shock.  
I have a dentist appointment tomorrow at 11:30.  Oy.
I fixed a whole in the sofa.  
Bug Juice is over now, so I'm going to get some milk.  Until next time...

Old age sucks.  Just so everyone knows, I have 28 days until my birthday and 27 until Brian gets here.  Yup.  
This brightened my day.  http://www.penny-arcade.com/view.php3  Look at the August 4, 2004 comic.  It has Gabe, Tyco, and Jesus.  
I guess that's all I have for now.  My new phone is soooooooooo sweet.  It's a Verizon A670.  It has a camera with flash AND a video maker.  YES!  Until next time...

I'm trying to take my mind off of things.  Here's one way:
If your life were a movie.. this would be it's soundtrack:
Opening Credits: Introduction And Royal March Of The Lion (Carnival of the Animals)-Saint-Sains
Waking up scene: Good Morning Starshine-Strawberry Alarm Clock
Average day scene: P.I.M.P.-50 Cent (well, I am one)

First date scene: Cigarettes and Chocolate Milk-Rufus Wainwight (it's a fun little ditty)
Falling in love scene: If I Ain't Got You-Alicia Keys
Love scene: The Nearness of You-Norah Jones
Fight with friend scene: Sunan Dances-Dorothy Chang
Break up scene: End of the Road-Boyz II Men
Get back together scene: Comfortable-John Mayer
"Life's okay" scene:  No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problem-Kenny Chesney
Heartbreak scene: By Your Side-Sade
Mental breakdown scene: My Immortal (CD version)-Evanescence
Driving scene: Devil Went Down to Georgia-Charlie Daniels
Lesson learning scene: Hallelujah Chorus-Handel
Deep thought scene: Arabesque No. 1- Debussy

Long night alone scene: Push-Sarah McLachlan
Death scene: Bydlo (Pictures At An Exhibition)-Mussorgsky
Closing credits: Pines of Rome-Respighi
Until next time...

I went shopping with my mom today.  I got some stuff for school.  Some clothes.  I saw Reanna in Hot Topic.  I want those black and pink Chucks.  They're so sweet.  
I got this in an e-mail from Sherrod:
1. What time do you get up? 9ish, lately
2. If you could eat lunch with one person, who would it be? Brian
3. Gold or silver? Silver
4. What was the last film you saw at the cinema? Stepford Wives
5. What is/are your favorite TV show(s)? Will and Grace, Queer As Folk, Law and Order:SVU, Dead Zone, A Different World, and my soaps
6. What did you have for breakfast? I don't eat breakfast
7. Who would you hate to be stuck in a room with? Everyone at some point
8. What inspires you? Random things 
9. What is your middle name? Marie
10. Beach, City or Country? The City
11. Favorite ice cream? Strawberry with Snickers, cookie dough, and gummy bears in a waffle bowl
12. Butter, plain or salted popcorn? Cheese 
13. Favorite color? Blue...or rainbows
14. What kind of car do you drive? I'm a sad pedestrian
15. Favorite sandwich? Walter Higgins with mushrooms on a garlic bagel
16. What characteristics do you despise? Ignorance
17. Favorite flowers? Roses
18. Where would you go on vacation? Japan, Italy, Chicago, Orlando, San Fransisco, New York
19. What color is your bathroom? Columbus: white, Clay Co: one is purple and one is blue
20. Favorite brand of clothing? Anything that looks good  
21. Where would you retire? It depends on where I am and where my family is
22. Favorite day of the week? Friday after convo
23. What did you do for your last birthday? Went out to eat with Chris, Jennrags, and Daniel
24. Where were you born? Elkhart, Indiana (I'm a Hoosier)
25. Favorite sport to watch? Diving, Gymnastics, Softball, College Volleyball
26. What fabric detergent do you use? Whatever is cheap
27. Coke or Pepsi? Pepsi
28. Are you a morning person or a night owl? Night
29. What is your shoe size? 9 wide

32. What time is it? 10:21pm
33. Name as it appears on birth certificate? Kelly Marie Cornett
34. Nicknames? Kelly-Bob, Baby Girl, Smelly Kelly, Kelly Bobins
35. Number of candles on your last birthday cake? 20 (32 days!) 
36. Kids? None 
37. Hair color:Brown
38. Piercing: 7 
39. Eyes? Brown
40. How much do you love your job? Gigging is great
41. Residence: Ellenwood, GA or Columbus, GA
42. Favorite Food? Chinese, Japanese, Krystal, Walter Higgins
43. Been to Africa? No, but I know someone who has.  Does that count?
Until next time...

I was going to compose an entry of my thoughts on the Democratic National Convention.  I'm not going now.  Maybe some other day, but not now.  It's not worth it.  I came home today to Clay Co.  My mom told me that she went to dinner with Melanie's mom the other day.  Dorothy said that Cherokee passed away this month.  I am in total shock.  She said he had colon cancer.  It is extremely rare to have it that young, or so I was told.  His birthday is October 15.  I still remember that after all these years(so many people from school shared that birthday).  He was one of my closest friends growing up.  I new him in 3rd grade when his mom came to our class and taught us dances to Michael Jackson's music.  Then we both went to the same middle school and joined orchestra.  We worked together to learn the bass.  Me, Cherokee, Reanna, and Jarred.  The 'Killer Bs' as we were known.  The best bass section ever.  He left Morrow High, but I still saw him at football games and other events.  He was one of the first people to call me Kelly-Bob.  One of the ones who brought it from East Clayton Elementary to Adamson Middle, then to Morrow High.  He was a great person with a fabulous soul and he will be missed.  We love you Cherokee.  Until next time...

So, this morning was no fun.  I woke up with this horrible chest pain.  I've never felt anything like that before.  So, I lay in bed for about 30 minutes, then I decide to get up to see if that helps.  It doesn't.  Then I try drinking some water, which made me feel worse.  It actually made breathing harder.  So, I call Terrance and he takes me to the "Doctor's Hospital" on Veterans.  They give me a check-up with blood work and x-rays, the whole she-bang.  They tell me that I have acid reflux (and I see that I still have extremely high blood pressure).  So I get a prescription for some medicine to help with it.  It was THE worst pain.  I hope I never have to feel that again.  Thanks to my friends who make me feel better.  :-D  Terrnace, thanks for the ride...I owe you one.
It's storming, so I'm going to get off the computer now.  I HATE storms.  Until next time...

I had a pretty fun weekend.  Friday was my sleeping day.  It was great.  I slept, got up to eat and watch my soaps, slept some more, watched tv and ate dinner, then slept again.  I guess it was my body making up for lost time.  
Me and Sherrod and Eddie spent the day at Dr. Jacobs' house.  Her and Ann and David went out of town, and Eddie is house sitting.  They have four black cats that are so cute.  We watched tv and ate lunch and played 'Monopoly'.  I hate that game...usually, but this time I SOOOOO kicked their asses.  It was the first time I finished the game, and the first time I won.  Woot for me.  Today was productive.  I did my dishes, moved my bedroom furniture around, did my homework, and watched the season finale of 'Queer As Folk'.  It was kind of a let down.  Now I'm home, updating my journal. 
So, here's my ghetto plans for going to the John Mayer concert next month, if I can.  There's a shuttle that runs from Columbus to the airport in Atlanta.  Then I can take Marta to the HiFiBy Amphitheater (aka Lakewood).  I see the show, then get home the same way.  It all depends on school.  The concert is on a Sunday night, and I have a class the following Monday at 9 am.  I guess I'll have to play it by ear.
I need a soda.  Until next time...

One male in the Chicago area.  22 years old.  Answers to the name of Brian.  About 5'10" and not a member of the fat kids club.  If you seen this man, please contact Kelly.  
Heidi came down this weekend for the fourth...or as I like to call it 'Republican National Holiday' (don't ask why...you'll just get your feelings hurt).  We partied Saturday night, and went shopping and hung out with Sherrod and Eddie.  How much fun was that?  Alot.
Classes are going on...I need new music.
So yeah.  That's pretty much it.  Hm, now I want some chili.  Damn it.  Until next time...

Stupid people in my country.  That's what it takes for me to write an entry after a couple of weeks.  Yes, I know it's everyone's country who is an American.  I, however, have taken away the right to call it everyone else's country but mine because I've seen too many STUPID ASS PEOPLE on my tv today:  
FIRST, people are trying to say that Bill Cosby doesn't know what he's talking about and that he's wrong.  NOT!!!  Bill Cosby is my hero.  He has been since I watched the Cosby show as a child (and I still watch the reruns).  Dr. Cosby (yes, he's a doctor now) is only speaking the truth.  I know exactly what he's talking about because I GREW UP WITH THOSE KIDS!!!  They make up my whole county.  I love them, I really do.  Besides, it's not just black kids (at least where I live) that can fit into this category that he's talking about.  And don't try to say that it's just a thing of the 'white man trying to keep the black man down'.  Yes, we all joke about it (at least I do), but it's far from the truth.  And don't try to say that all white people are racist and that's the root of it all.  There ARE racists out there, but they're everywhere on earth.  I've even had people be racist toward me...TWICE!!! (yes, it can happen)  Dr. Cosby, keep on saying what you're saying.  You're one of the few in this country that knows what they're talking about.
SECOND, John Kerry is saying that if he's president, he will create a law that gives amnesty to those illegal immigrants who sneak past the system for five years and will give them citizenship in America.  Am I the only one who sees something wrong with that?  If you come to this country from another, and you work hard and do everything the right and legal way, then yes, you may be a citizen.  If you sneak around for five years and you don't get caught, you should not be allowed to jump in front of the line like a fat kid at lunch.  It doesn't work like that...trust me, I know.  
THIRD, I'm not going to touch Michael Moore's movie.  I don't even like speaking it's name.  I have not seen it, and I am not going to pay money to see it.  Maybe when it comes on PBS or GPTV.  Who knows, maybe I'll be having a good day and give it a chance and watch it on HBO.  THEN, I will give my opinion on it.  However, I will say that someone who does not vote or does not plan to vote has no right to say anything about the country or those who run it.  If you don't like the way it's run, then leave.  I won't miss you.
Until next time...

I know it's been a while since my last update.  I don't even remember what I talked about, but that's not really important.  Life has been hectic and fun all at the same time.  I started my 'Movement in the Arts' class.  I love Dr. Hansen, I really do, but that class is going to kill me.  Having to deal with all that stuff, on main campus, with 20-something non-music majors is not a good thing.  God, give me the strength.  
I've been hanging out with Sherrod, Eddie, and Stephanie Blocker lately.  We go to Judy Bug's Books and to dinner and whatnot.  We went to Columbus Pride today...yeeeeeeeah, that was interesting.  After that we went swimming and chilled at Sherrod and Eddie's.  A Margaret Cho special was supposed to come on, but it didn't.  I was so mad.  However, I got to see last week's 'Queer as Folk'.  I LOVE BRIAN AND JUSTIN!!!  I'm going over to their place tomorrow to watch the new episode.  What a great show!  
Oh, Stephanie.  I just wanted to let you know that Andres Diaz is coming next March to do a concert with the CSO.  Maybe you could pop into C-town???
I guess that's all that I have to report for the time being.  Maybe there will be more later.  Until next time...

Yes, the accusations are true.  Chris killed Stephanie's plant.  I'm going to post the 'corpse' in a later entry...once I draw it.  I have MADD Crayola skills.
I took my math test today.  I am so tired.  Richard came down and stayed the night at my place 'cause he was on his way to Valdosta to be a RA at GHP.  We were up 'till 1 or 2 something.  Not a good idea when you have an 8:30 test.  Luckly it was easy as balls.  SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO easy.  It was a waste of time.  Stupid class.  Dr. Hansen's class starts Monday.  I can hardly contain myself...except not.
Aw, how I missed C-town.  
My stool is missing again.  If you find it, please let me know.  
I got my keyboard to work.  Now I just need to program the temp. scanner until I get the other one from home.  Woot.
Are you tired?  I am, so I'm going to stop typing.  Until next time...

I can't believe that I just watched my last episode of 'Queer As Folk' at home.  It sucks that I don't get Showtime in Columbus.  Stupid cheap cable.  Maybe one day I will be able to upgrade.  I just want that channel and Noggin (so I can watch 'Degrassi).  I'm such a kid.
OH...there is one more channel I want.  THE PLAYGIRL CHANNEL!!!  They're coming out with a Playgirl channel!!!!!!!!  I sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo can't wait to see that.  It makes me want to bring out my issues and look at them.  I haven't done that in a while.  That's something for me to do when I get back to C-town this week.  
In other news, the band Creed officially broke up today.  The guitarist and drummer ditched that lead singer guy.  They've rehired the former Creed bassist and found a new singer.  They said the politics got in the way.  You know, I don't blame politics.  I don't blame anyone in Creed.  I blame Pearl Jam.  It's their fault we had that wave of sappy-mood bands in the late 90s/early 2000s.  Yup, that's who to blame.  Good thing they're over.
I'm not watching 'Futurama' right now because my father is recording something on A&E.  
John Mayer and Maroon 5 will be in Atlanta on August 29.  The concert is at the HiFi Buys Amphlitheatre.  It's a Sunday, and yes, class would be on Monday (although I'm all for skipping).  Hopefully, if I'm working at the music library, I can get that day off.  If you wanna go, let's talk.  You could meet my future husband.  I'm sure John wouldn't mind.  J/K...maybe.
My parents are cleaning out the attic and they have all this crap everywhere.  I have THE cutest glasses from back in the day.  They also have all these newspaper clippings.  It just so happens that they have the whole paper from 'The Washington Post' that is the day Reagan was sworn into office and the American hostages in Iran were set free.  It's pretty neat.
BUSH '04!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Until next time...

So, Jennifer had her baby yesterday.  Victor the 3rd was born on June 04, 2004 at 6:30 p.m.  She's a mommy.  Aw.  I wish I could see them, but I don't have a way to the hospital.  Damn pedestrian ways.
Today is a sad day.  President Reagan died today.  He was 93.  He was, by far, one of THE best presidents we've had.  He accomplished soooooooooo much while he was in office.  He will be missed.
I just finished looking at pointe shoes on eBay.  I found some that I like, it just depends on when I feel like bidding.  I *heart* eBay.com.
I have this really weird feeling right now.  I don't know what it is, but I don't like it.  Not at all.
Until next time...
